item.title: Buy iPhone 14 512GB under Rs 77000: Amazon offers major discounts - India TV News
item.description:
Buy iPhone 14 512GB under Rs 77000: Amazon offers major discounts

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

If you are planning to upgrade to an iPhone and do not want to break the bank, then now is the time to do so. Amazon has slashed the price of the iPhone 14 512GB variant, offering customers incredible deals and discounts to end the year on a high note.

Key Points:

  • Apple is offering significant discounts on older models due to the launch of the iPhone 16 series.
  • The iPhone 14 512GB was originally priced at Rs 1,09,900 and is now available for Rs 76,900 after a 30% discount.
  • Additional bank discounts, EMI options, and exchange offers are available on Amazon.
  • The iPhone 14 features a premium design, advanced cameras, and the A15 Bionic chipset.

Notable Quotes:

“With advanced features, excellent performance, and an attractive price cut, the iPhone 14 512GB offers unbeatable value for money.”

This significant discount on the iPhone 14 is a great opportunity for consumers looking to upgrade without overspending.

item.title: OnePlus 13R vs. OnePlus 12R: Biggest expected upgrades - Tom's Guide
item.description:
OnePlus 13R vs. OnePlus 12R: Biggest Expected Upgrades

Publication Date: January 7, 2024
Source: Tom's Guide

The upcoming OnePlus 13R promises to bring notable upgrades over its predecessor, the OnePlus 12R, particularly in performance and battery life. The article discusses the expected specifications, pricing, and design similarities between the two models.

  • The OnePlus 13R is rumored to feature a Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset, improving performance and battery life.
  • The device is expected to retain the same screen size and refresh rate as the OnePlus 12R.
  • Battery capacity is set to increase to 6,000 mAh compared to the 5,500 mAh of the 12R.
  • Price points for the OnePlus 13R are still uncertain, with speculation on whether a 128GB model will be available.
“The addition of a Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset could be enough to propel the OnePlus 13R far ahead of its predecessor.”

This new model aims to attract bargain hunters with competitive specifications without sacrificing much in quality.

item.title: eSIM from BSNL by March, to complete India-wide rollout by June 2025 - The Indian Express
item.description:
BSNL to Launch eSIM by March 2025, Completing 4G Rollout by June 2025

Publication Date: December 20, 2024

Source: Indian Express

Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) has announced significant updates regarding the rollout of its services, including the launch of eSIM services by March 2025 and the completion of nationwide 4G rollout by June 2025.

  • BSNL will offer eSIM services, which is a notable advancement for users with devices that support it.
  • The company confirmed that it will complete 4G network deployment across the country by June 2025.
  • VoLTE and VoWiFi services will also be launched in a phased manner as part of the rollout.
  • BSNL currently has no plans for a tariff hike, unlike private telecom operators.
  • BSNL plans to install a total of 100,000 towers for its 4G network across India, with 22,000 already planned under the 4G saturation project.
“BSNL is in the process of rolling out 4G services pan India, and the process is likely to be completed by June 2025.” — Sandeep Govil, Director Consumer Mobility

The upcoming services reflect BSNL's commitment to enhancing connectivity and service offerings in India, aiming to provide competitive options in the telecom market.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs Galaxy S24 Ultra: Price In India, Launch Date, Design, Specs, Everything You Need - Times Now
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra vs Galaxy S24 Ultra: Price In India, Launch Date, Design, Specs

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

The Galaxy S25 Ultra is set to launch in January 2025, promising to enhance design and features of the S24 Ultra. Here’s a rundown of anticipated specifications, launch details, and pricing information.

Key Points:

  • The Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected to launch on January 22, 2025, during the Galaxy Unpacked event.
  • Its price in India is likely to be similar to the S24 Ultra, around Rs 1,29,999, with a potential increase due to upgraded features.
  • The new model is expected to be lighter and sleeker, weighing around 14 grams less than its predecessor.
  • It will feature a Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and upgraded camera specifications, with rumors of a new 50MP ultra-wide sensor replacing the current 12MP sensor.
“While the Galaxy S25 Ultra promises exciting updates, it’s important to remember that these details are based on leaks and speculation.”

In conclusion, the anticipation surrounding the Galaxy S25 Ultra suggests it’ll be a noteworthy release, continuing Samsung's trend of innovation in its flagship series.

item.title: Tech this week: Lava Blaze Duo 5G, Realme 14X 5G and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tech this week: Lava Blaze Duo 5G, Realme 14X 5G and more

Date: December 2024

The third week of December 2024 has witnessed the launch of several mid-range smartphones, boasting new specifications and features at affordable prices. As New Year 2025 approaches, budget-conscious consumers can look forward to new handsets.

  • Lava Blaze Duo 5G: Features a 6.67-inch curved AMOLED display, 64MP camera, and 5,000mAh battery starting from ₹14,999.
  • Realme 14X 5G: Offers dust and water resistance with a 6,000mAh battery priced at ₹14,999.
  • Poco M7 Pro 5G: Priced from ₹14,999, with a full-HD+ display and 50-megapixel camera.
  • Poco C75 5G: Budget-friendly option at ₹7,999 with a 6.88-inch screen and 50-megapixel rear camera.
  • Lenovo Yoga Slim 7i Aura Edition: Premium laptop priced at ₹1,49,990 with 18-hour battery life and powerful AI performance.

item.title: Mukesh Ambani’s big move, Reliance launches JioTag Go in India at Rs…, challenges Apple’s Air Tag with more… - India.com
item.description:
Reliance Jio Launches Affordable JioTag Go to Compete with Apple AirTag

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India.com

The JioTag Go, introduced by billionaire Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Jio, is a Bluetooth-enabled tracker that competes directly with Apple’s AirTag, offering a lower price and enhanced features.

  • JioTag Go utilizes Bluetooth v5.3 technology for secure signals.
  • Compatible with Google’s Find My Device network for easy tracking of items.
  • Features include a built-in speaker, replaceable battery, and unknown tracker alerts.
  • Available at a launch price of Rs 1,499, down from the original price of Rs 2,999.
"JioTag Go helps users locate their valuables by easily attaching to items like keys, wallets, and pets."

This launch positions Reliance as a significant player in the technology space, particularly in tracking devices.

item.title: Weekly poll results: the Redmi Note 14 Pro+ is easily the most popular of the three - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Weekly poll results: the Redmi Note 14 Pro+ is easily the most popular of the three

Publication Date: Date not specified Source: Not specified

This week's poll reveals the Redmi Note 14 Pro+ as the clear favorite among the Redmi Note 14 series, outperforming its siblings significantly.

  • The Redmi Note 14 Pro+ is favored due to its superior specs, including a telephoto camera and faster storage options.
  • The Redmi Note 14 Pro is viewed as less appealing due to shared flaws and fewer features.
  • The base model, Redmi Note 14, is less popular but includes unique features like a microSD card slot.
  • Xiaomi plans to launch the Redmi Note 14 series in Europe, but pricing details remain vague.
“The addition of a telephoto camera (50MP 60mm), a faster chipset (Snapdragon 7s Gen 3) and the option for faster storage (UFS 3.1 on 256+ gig models), plus the larger battery with faster charging (6,200mAh, 90W) are well worth it for the price.”

In conclusion, the popularity of the Redmi Note 14 Pro+ highlights consumers' preference for devices with enhanced features and capabilities.

item.title: iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone 17 Pro Launch Date, Price, Design, Specifications, Leaks, All You Need To Know - Times Now
item.description:
iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone 17 Pro Launch Date, Price, Design, Specifications, Leaks, All You Need To Know

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

While the iPhone 16 series is still fresh in the market, the iPhone 17 lineup is already the subject of numerous leaks and rumors. It is expected to bring four models: the iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max, and a new model called the iPhone 17 Air or Slim. Apple might discontinue the 'Plus' lineup with this new introduction.

  • The iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max are expected to feature design changes including a return to aluminium for durability.
  • Enhanced A19 Pro chip for better performance and efficiency.
  • Camera upgrades with three 48MP rear cameras and a 24MP front camera.
  • The expected launch date is September 2025, with pricing starting at $999 in the US and Rs 1,19,900 in India.
"The iPhone 17 Pro Max will reportedly feature three 48MP cameras, including a Wide, Ultra Wide, and Tetraprism Telephoto lens."

In conclusion, the iPhone 17 series is set to bring significant upgrades and changes, maintaining Apple's tradition of innovation.

item.title: Are We Addicted to Smartphones? Stats Reveals Usage Gap Between Gen Z vs Boomers - Softonic EN
item.description:
Are We Addicted to Smartphones? Stats Reveal Usage Gap Between Gen Z vs Boomers

Publication Date: 2024-09-26 | Source: Softonic

This article explores the dramatic rise in smartphone usage worldwide, examining the differences in smartphone habits between Generation Z and Baby Boomers. With nearly 5 billion smartphone users globally, the implications of this trend are immense.

  • Approximately 4.88 billion people worldwide own a smartphone; expected to reach 6 billion by 2027.
  • The average person spends about 4 hours and 37 minutes on their smartphone daily.
  • Gen Zers report spending an average of 6 hours and 5 minutes on smartphones.
  • Smartphone usage in the U.S. shows a steady increase, reflecting a growing addiction to mobile technology.
"36% of Americans believe they have a screen time addiction."

The increase in smartphone use continues to raise questions about digital addiction and its social implications.

item.title: Google's next generative AI editing tools will mimic real lenses and remix existing photos - Digital Camera World
item.description:
Google's Next Generative AI Editing Tools Will Mimic Real Lenses and Remix Existing Photos

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Digital Camera World

Google is testing an update to Veo, a generative AI video platform, which enhances its ability to replicate specific lenses and cinematic effects. The announcements include Veo 2, the Imagen 3 generative image platform, and an experimental AI program called Whisk.

  • Veo 2 allows users to specify cinematic parameters like lens type, and understands detailed cinematography terms.
  • Videos generated by Veo 2 will include SynthID, a watermark to identify AI-generated content.
  • Google's Whisk combines images and styles from user uploads to generate new mixed images.
  • Imagen 3 produces more realistic images and improves upon previous versions with better composition and textures.
“The software better understands human movements and expressions, reducing unnecessary details such as extra fingers.”

The software updates are available for testing to selected users and are expected to roll out across Google products, including YouTube Shorts.

item.title: Vuls: A Free, Open Source Vulnerability Scanner for Linux - The New Stack
item.description:
Vuls: A Free, Open Source Vulnerability Scanner for Linux

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: The New Stack

If you need to scan the machines on your network for vulnerabilities, Vuls is a great option as it offers various scanning methods and is agentless.

  • Supports local and remote scanning via SSH.
  • Uses several vulnerability databases to detect vulnerabilities.
  • Two installation methods: advanced installation and simpler one from standard repositories.
  • Configuration involves creating directories and editing a configuration file.
  • Users can run scans on specific distributions such as RHEL 9.
"Give this tool a try and see if it helps you uncover vulnerabilities on the machines connected to your LAN."

In conclusion, Vuls provides a straightforward yet powerful way to ensure the security of systems within a network.

item.title: I thought the tri-folding Huawei Mate XT was a gimmick, but then I held it - TechRadar
item.description:
First Impressions of the Huawei Mate XT: A Revolutionary Tri-Folding Smartphone

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: TechRadar

The Huawei Mate XT is the world’s first commercially available dual-screen, tri-folding smartphone. Initial skepticism about its practicality seems misplaced after a hands-on experience, revealing the device's impressive build and unique design.

  • The Huawei Mate XT features a unique tri-fold design, offering three displays yet compressing into a portable size.
  • It measures 6.4 inches when collapsed and expands to 10.2 inches when fully unfolded.
  • The device is equipped with a Kirin 9010 chipset, 16GB RAM, and storage options from 256GB to 1TB.
  • The phone boasts a solid build quality with robust hinges that hold positions without flopping.
  • It includes a three-lens rear camera setup, consisting of a 50MP main lens, a 12MP ultra-wide lens, and a 12MP periscope lens, plus an 8MP selfie camera.
“Seeing is believing, but feeling is the truth.”

The Huawei Mate XT is not yet available globally, but its design hints at a promising future for foldable technology, showcasing a potential shift that could make folding phones more practical and appealing.

item.title: iPhone 14, iPhone SE Sales in EU to Be Discontinued Due to Upcoming Regulation: Report - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Apple's iPhone 14 and iPhone SE (2022) Expected to Be Discontinued in 27 EU Countries

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Gadgets 360

Apple has started discontinuing the sales of the iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, and iPhone SE (2022) in Switzerland, preparing for compliance with upcoming common charger regulations in the EU.

  • Discontinuation is expected across all 27 EU member countries.
  • The deadline for compliance with the new regulations is December 28.
  • Current sales of these models will continue in-store until the deadline.
  • Customers will have to switch to newer models like the iPhone 15 or 16, which are equipped with USB Type-C ports.
  • Apple is working on a fourth generation iPhone SE model that may launch soon.
"When the December 28 deadline arrives, Apple won't officially sell an iPhone SE model in the EU, while resellers can continue to sell remaining units."

The shift to discontinuing older models marks a significant change for Apple as it aligns its products with new European regulations.

item.title: OnePlus Open 2 Launch Timeline Leaked; Might Debut Later Than Expected - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Here's When the OnePlus Open 2 Might Be Launched in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Gadgets 360

The OnePlus Open 2 is anticipated to be unveiled in the second half of 2025 as a follow-up to the first generation. It may debut as a rebranded Oppo Find N5 and feature the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.

  • Expected launch in the second half of 2025.
  • Will be a rebranded version of the Oppo Find N5.
  • Expected to feature Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • Possible upgraded battery from 4,800mAh to 5,700mAh.
  • No official word from OnePlus on the launch yet.
“It's worth taking these claims with a grain of salt, as there's no word from OnePlus about whether — or when — the company plans to introduce the successor to the first generation OnePlus Open.”

As more information becomes available, the anticipation for the OnePlus Open 2 and its specifications will grow leading up to its release.
